TopicTitle: Need some explanation with pasting over modulemanager.dll files pleae

Articles.Content:
Question is, if you put into gamedata folder mods that share module manager file with same number, for example ModuleManager.2.5.9.dll, well you have to overwrite the first version so do that make that earlier pasted in mod broken??????? And would renaming that second dll file into like ModuleManager.2.5.91.dll so and first .2.5.9.dll remains work to have both mods working as intended???

Sorry for nob questions
No, All module managers of the same version are fine, and all module manager plugins are backwards compatable. You will only ever need one of the latest version of Module Manager.

Overwriting ModuleManager.2.5.9.dll with another ModuleManager.2.5.9.dll should be fine; they should be the exact same file.

You want to only have one ModuleManager dll installed.
Keep only 1 module manager .dll in your game folder at all time, and make sure it is the latest version. Duplicate .dll will do bad things.
